issue.title: [R] Bundled C++ build fails with ccache
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12654](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Dear Apache Team,

I'm not able to install Arrow 4.0.0 properly on Debian 10 via Docker. I tried several switches from recommendation here: [https://arrow.apache.org/docs/r/articles/install.html](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/r/articles/install.html.) (ARROW_USE_PKG_CONFIG TRUE/FALSE, LIBARROW_BINARY TRUE/FALSE) but with no success so far.

Here the latest log:
```java

* installing *source* package ‘arrow’ ...
** package ‘arrow’ successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked
trying URL 'https://arrow-r-nightly.s3.amazonaws.com/libarrow/bin/debian-10/arrow-4.0.0.zip'
Error in download.file(from_url, to_file, quiet = quietly) : 
  cannot open URL 'https://arrow-r-nightly.s3.amazonaws.com/libarrow/bin/debian-10/arrow-4.0.0.zip'
*** No C++ binaries found for debian-10
trying URL 'https://arrow-r-nightly.s3.amazonaws.com/libarrow/src/arrow-4.0.0.zip'
Error in download.file(from_url, to_file, quiet = quietly) : 
  cannot open URL 'https://arrow-r-nightly.s3.amazonaws.com/libarrow/src/arrow-4.0.0.zip'
trying URL 'https://www.apache.org/dyn/closer.lua?action=download&filename=arrow/arrow-4.0.0/apache-arrow-4.0.0.tar.gz'
Content type 'application/octet-stream' length 9042294 bytes (8.6 MB)
==================================================
downloaded 8.6 MB

*** Successfully retrieved C++ source
*** Building C++ libraries
*** Building with MAKEFLAGS= -j2 
**** cmake
trying URL 'https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/releases/download/v3.19.2/cmake-3.19.2-Linux-x86_64.tar.gz'
Content type 'application/octet-stream' length 42931014 bytes (40.9 MB)
==================================================
downloaded 40.9 MB

**** arrow with SOURCE_DIR="/tmp/RtmpykibIC/file77bf2da3d338/apache-arrow-4.0.0/cpp" BUILD_DIR="/tmp/RtmpykibIC/file77bf609e654f" DEST_DIR="libarrow/arrow-4.0.0" CMAKE="/tmp/RtmpykibIC/file77bf5d6bcf01/cmake-3.19.2-Linux-x86_64/bin/cmake" CC="ccache gcc" CXX="ccache g++ -std=gnu++11" LDFLAGS="-Wl,-z,relro" ARROW_S3=OFF ARROW_MIMALLOC=OFF 
++ pwd
+ : /tmp/Rtmpru2gYI/R.INSTALL779923ea9560/arrow

++ mkdir -p libarrow/arrow-4.0.0
++ cd libarrow/arrow-4.0.0
++ pwd
```

Thanks and Br

Stephan

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17339256) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Looks like jemalloc is failing to build (configure, actually) for some reason. We could explore that if you want, and/or you can disable jemalloc by setting the environment variable ARROW_JEMALLOC=OFF prior to installing.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17339277) by Stephan Radel (StephanRadel):*

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17339278) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
You could, but clearly something's not right so we should dig in. Can you `export EXTRA_CMAKE_FLAGS="-DARROW_VERBOSE_THIRDPARTY_BUILD=ON"` and retry? That should tell us what the actual errors are in better detail.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17339648) by Stephan Radel (StephanRadel):*
Hi Neal,

just found the cause ... there were some optimizations applied according this blogpost: [http://dirk.eddelbuettel.com/blog/2017/11/27/.](http://dirk.eddelbuettel.com/blog/2017/11/27/) Obviously the described ccache-method prevented R+arrow from compiling properly. When I turned off this optimization, everything works as expected.

Sorry for bothering you with that topic and thanks a lot for your support!

Br

Stephan

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17340429) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Thanks, glad you've worked through the issue. I don't quite understand why the build is failing with ccache, so I've reopened this so we can investigate more.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17392917) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
`[~npr]` Do you still plan to investigate?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17393093) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
It's probably worth someone investigating

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17393666) by Stephan Radel (StephanRadel):*
Hi Antoine, hi Neal, I'm afraid I don't have time to investigate this further. I understand that we have not yet found the root cause. But removing the optimisation has solved my acute problem. Thanks for your support!!

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12654?focusedCommentId=17526574) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
We resolved an issue that looks very similar in ARROW-14638 and I suspect this will be resolved by that as well. I'm going to close this for now, but if you do still run into this issue after our next release (8.0.0, which should be done shortly) either re-open this, or please create a new Jira so we can dig into it. Thanks!
